alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 4:19PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A band of heavy snow will affect central York...Rockingham... southeastern Strafford and southeastern Hillsborough Counties... At 417 PM EST...A band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Lebanon to Pepperell...and moving southeast AT 15 MPH. This band will cross portions of Interstates 93 and 95 betwen 430 PM and 545 PM. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Nashua, Derry, Rochester, Biddeford, Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Alfred, Sanford, Merrimack, Salem, Dover, Bedford, Saco, Somersworth, Kennebunk and Barrington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 93 between mile markers 0 and 18. Interstate 95 between mile markers 1 and 39. Interstate 95 in New Hampshire between mile markers 0 and 16. This also includes... Hampton Beach, York Beach, Ogunquit Beach, Wells Beach, and Fortunes Rock Beach. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow. * Sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this area of heavy snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
